decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy by using cards like Ensnaring Bridge, Pithing Needle, Thoughtseize, and Lantern of Insight. The deck also utilizes tutors such as Whir of Invention and Ancient Stirrings to find the necessary pieces while using Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to generate mana and card advantage. The deck also has a few win conditions such as Pyrite Spellbomb and milling the opponent's deck using Codex Shredder and Pyxis of Pandemonium. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and includes utility lands like Inventors' Fair and Academy Ruins.

This Mardu Midrange deck focuses on aggressive play with a combination of red, black, and white cards. The aim is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also removing their threats with cards like Terminate and Dreadbore. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers such as Liliana of the Veil and strong creatures like Bedlam Reveler and Young Pyromancer. Additionally, it includes disruptive cards like Blood Moon to hinder opponents' strategies. The deck's mana base consists of various fetch lands and shock lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to enable the casting of powerful creatures like Hollow One and Gurmag Angler for a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to maintain control over the board. The strategy revolves around utilizing the graveyard as a resource to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and efficient card advantage, while also having access to disruptive spells to handle opposing strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by efficiently countering opponents' spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. The deck utilizes a combination of counter spells like Mana Leak and Cryptic Command, removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrade, and card draw spells like Serum Visions and Ancestral Vision. The win condition is to flip Thing in the Ice or generate tokens with Young Pyromancer, while also utilizing Snapcaster Mage to recast instants and sorceries from the graveyard for additional value.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. This deck also utilizes cards like Liliana of the Veil and Lingering Souls to control the board and grind out incremental advantages. Additionally, the deck has answers to a variety of threats with removal spells like Fatal Push and Maelstrom Pulse, while also having some graveyard hate with cards like Nihil Spellbomb. Ultimately, this deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total while controlling the game state.

This Modern 1 vs 1 Aggro - Humans deck focuses on utilizing a wide variety of Human creatures with synergy to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. The deck includes cards that provide mana acceleration, disruption through counterspells and bouncing abilities, as well as pump effects to boost the power of the creatures. The goal is to establish a strong board presence quickly and maintain pressure on the opponent, ensuring victory through aggressive combat strategies.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature-based gameplay, using human creatures that benefit from each other's presence on the battlefield. The main objective is to quickly build a board presence by playing efficient creatures such as Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play, while cards like Reflector Mage provide tempo advantage. The mana base is optimized to support a fast and consistent deployment of human creatures, making it a potent aggro deck in Modern format.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay and utilizes the powerful Death's Shadow card as its main strategy. It combines efficient and versatile creatures such as Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer with disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's options. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to handle threats. It utilizes cards like Liliana of the Veil and Traverse the Ulvenwald for card advantage and consistency. Finally, it includes powerful finishers like Temur Battle Rage to quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on using life loss as a resource to enable powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf to quickly take control of the game. The deck runs a suite of disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to control the board. The deck also includes a suite of removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats, while also having access to ways to pump up its creatures for lethal attacks.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage. By using cards like Supreme Verdict, Path to Exile, and Cryptic Command, the player can dictate the pace of the game and eliminate threats from the opponent. Cards like Search for Azcanta and Sphinx's Revelation provide card advantage and dig deeper into the deck for key answers. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Gideon of the Trials and Jace, Architect of Thought to further control the board and outvalue the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until victory is achieved.

This UW Control deck relies on powerful planeswalkers and versatile counter spells to control the game and outvalue opponents. With cards like Gideon Jura, Jace, Architect of Thought, and Vendilion Clique, the deck can answer threats while generating card advantage. Cryptic Command and Supreme Verdict provide flexible answers to a variety of situations, while Path to Exile and Detention Sphere handle problematic creatures and permanents. The deck aims to stabilize the board, draw cards, disrupt opponents, and eventually win the game through incremental advantage and powerful finishers like Celestial Colonnade.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with cheap artifact creatures and use various buffs and abilities to overwhelm the opponent with damage. By utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Cranial Plating, the deck aims to aggressively attack the opponent while also having some protection with Etched Champion and Master of Etherium. The deck thrives on synergy between artifacts and creatures, using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to quickly ramp up and maintain a strong presence on the battlefield.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly build up a strong, evasive threat by playing hexproof creatures such as Slippery Bogle and Gladecover Scout and then equipping them with powerful auras like Ethereal Armor and Daybreak Coronet. The use of Leyline of Sanctity provides added protection against targeted removal spells, while cards like Rancor and Gryff's Boon help to further enhance the creature's abilities. This aggressive approach aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and secure a quick victory through the power of auras and hexproof.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Key cards like Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Eidolon of the Great Revel provide early pressure, while spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Boros Charm help finish off the opponent. Searing Blaze and Skullcrack also provide additional damage and disruption to control decks. The mana base is built to support the fast-paced gameplay, with fetch lands and shock lands ensuring consistent mana access for the low-to-the-ground strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes land destruction with Ghost Quarter to keep the opponent off balance. The deck is designed to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence with cards like Matter Reshaper and Reality Smasher. The inclusion of Karn Liberated provides a powerful late-game advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive Eldrazi creatures and disruptive elements.

Utilize a combination of disruption spells and creatures with powerful abilities to control the board and pressure the opponent with a mix of Eldrazi and Orzhov cards in order to overwhelm and outvalue the opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 matchup.

The deck focuses on utilizing Urza's lands to quickly ramp into powerful colorless threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes various ways to search for and assemble UrzaTron pieces, ensuring consistent access to mana. In addition, the deck includes removal spells and board wipes to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large threats while maintaining control of the game through efficient mana usage and removal spells.

This deck focuses on assembling the powerful UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate massive amounts of mana and cast big threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. It utilizes cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to search for the Tron lands efficiently, along with Ancient Stirrings to find key pieces. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like Oblivion Stone to control the board. Overall, the strategy revolves around ramping quickly and overpowering opponents with huge threats.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to control the game, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and generate card advantage through the use of powerful instant-speed spells like Cryptic Command and Kolaghan's Command, along with cards like Snapcaster Mage to reuse them. The deck also includes cards like Thought Scour and Search for Azcanta to filter through the deck and find the right answers. With efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Terminate, along with disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and eventually win the game through attrition.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Aggro - Death's Shadow deck is to rapidly decrease your own life total while playing powerful threats like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler. This strategy allows you to take advantage of the powerful abilities these creatures have, while also disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial. The deck also includes Snapcaster Mage for extra value and versatility, making it a well-rounded and aggressive deck that can quickly close out games.

The deck is focused on quickly reducing its own life total to enable powerful threats like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler. It combines hand disruption with efficient removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for additional value to be gained from spells in the graveyard. With a low mana curve and a focus on early aggression, this deck aims to apply pressure and control the game from the beginning, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with its powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Flameblade Adept, and Flamewake Phoenix to enable the casting of Hollow One for free. This allows for aggressive plays and significant damage output early in the game. Burning Inquiry, Faithless Looting, and Goblin Lore help enable this strategy by drawing cards and discarding them to fuel the graveyard. Lightning Bolt provides additional reach and removal, while Collective Brutality offers versatility in handling opposing threats. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, explosive plays and aggressive creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with aggressive Human creatures like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Mantis Rider, boosted by cards like Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial. It also disrupts opponents' strategies with Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage, while maintaining tempo with Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. Support from lands like Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory helps to consistently cast creatures, making it a fast-paced and efficient deck that aims to overwhelm opponents before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's draws and resources through cards like Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, and Ensnaring Bridge. By utilizing cards like Pithing Needle and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. The deck also includes various artifacts and land cards to support its strategy, with the ability to tutor for specific pieces with cards like Whir of Invention. The overall goal is to manipulate the game to the player's advantage and outlast the opponent.

The deck focuses on deploying powerful threats like Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf quickly, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald to manipulate its own card advantage and mana base efficiently. It looks to close out games quickly with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Temur Battle Rage, while also having access to powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to grind out longer matchups. The deck's key strategy is to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana, using cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells. The deck aims to cast multiple spells in one turn to build up a storm count, eventually finishing off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot. The deck includes card draw and selection to help find combo pieces, along with disruption like Remand to protect the combo. The end goal is to chain together spells and create a powerful storm turn to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Liliana of the Veil. Lingering Souls provides additional threats and card advantage, while removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay help clear the way for your creatures. The deck also has some lifegain and graveyard hate with cards like Scavenging Ooze and Collective Brutality. Overall, the deck aims to establish board presence early and maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on building a board presence quickly with low-cost Human creatures that benefit from each other's presence. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Reflector Mage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Meddling Mage disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mana base that supports a variety of color requirements, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure and outpace the opponent.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures, along with disruptive spells and removal, to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By creating token creatures with Young Pyromancer and Lingering Souls, while also removing threats with Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command, the deck aims to maintain pressure and control the board. The inclusion of discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's game plan while also fueling cards like Bedlam Reveler. Overall, this deck aims to be proactive and aggressive while maintaining a level of disruption.
